text:
the posted 1.3.27 md5 sums checks out but one posted for
apache_2.0.47-win32-x86-no_ssl.msi doesn't seem to

should i even worry about this?
thanks.
creator: danv_atlarge@yahoo.ca

text:
Yes, you should.

I've just checked the 2.0.47 msi md5 sum on www.apache.org and it appears to be
ok. Where did you download your msi copy?

Thanks for your care!
creator: nd@perlig.de
danv_atlarge@yahoo.ca
text:
I just grabbed the 2.0.47.msi from apache.org and as you said it checks out 
fine. So that's all good
The one failing was dloaded from the heanet.ie mirror. Any thoughts?
Thanks for getting back to me so fast.

I've just tested
ftp://ftp.heanet.ie/pub/apache/dist/httpd/binaries/win32/apache_2.0.47-win32-x86-no_ssl.msi
and the md5sum checks out just fine against the md5sum at
http://www.apache.org/dist/httpd/binaries/win32/apache_2.0.47-win32-x86-no_ssl.msi.md5

Maybe you were downloading in ascii? or perhaps the transfer failed?
creator: mads@apache.org
nd@perlig.de
text: No further response expected. Closing this report.
